private_information: I arrive at Richmond District at 9:00AM
I know travel times: Richmond District to Nob Hill is 17 minutes, Nob Hill to Richmond District is 14 minutes
I want to maximize the number of friends I meet and respect minimum meeting durations
traveler.goal: Generate candidate daily schedules and feasible meeting windows given my arrival time and known travel times

private_information: I will be at Nob Hill from 9:30AM to 11:15AM
I can meet for a minimum of 15 minutes during that window
My meeting location is Nob Hill
paul.goal: Provide precise availability and any preferences or constraints for meeting with the traveler

orchestrator.goal: Produce a PDDL domain and a PDDL problem for the FastDownward solver that encodes locations, travel durations, time windows, and meeting duration constraints and finds an optimal schedule to maximize meetings while respecting all constraints

public_information: Travel time from Richmond District to Nob Hill is 17 minutes
Travel time from Nob Hill to Richmond District is 14 minutes
You arrive at Richmond District at 9:00AM
Paul will be at Nob Hill from 9:30AM to 11:15AM
Minimum meeting duration with Paul is 15 minutes

generate_options.system_prompt: You are an agent that enumerates feasible schedule options and meeting windows given travel times and arrival time. Do not produce PDDL. Provide a structured list of candidate schedules with sequences of location visits, arrival and departure times, and feasibility notes.
generate_options.prompt: Your name is traveler. You have the following public information: {environment->public_information} You have the following private information: {agents->traveler->private_information} Your goal: {agents->traveler->goal} Think step by step and produce multiple candidate schedules and their timings in a structured form. If information is missing, state what is missing instead of making assumptions.

provide_availability.system_prompt: You are an agent representing a friend who provides availability windows and meeting preferences. Do not produce PDDL. Provide a clear availability statement and any constraints about meeting location or duration.
provide_availability.prompt: Your name is paul. You have the following public information: {environment->public_information} You have the following private information: {agents->paul->private_information} Your goal: {agents->paul->goal} State your precise availability window and any constraints regarding meeting location, earliest start, latest finish, and minimum duration.

pddl.system_prompt: You are an expert in multi-agent PDDL planning targeting the FastDownward solver. Produce a PDDL domain and a PDDL problem that encode locations, travel durations, time windows, and minimum meeting durations. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem> tags. Keep agent actions distinct and ensure the produced PDDL is compatible with FastDownward.
pddl.prompt: You are orchestrator. Use the public information and the inputs from other agents to build a single PDDL domain and problem that plans travel and meetings to maximize the number of friends met while satisfying arrival times, travel durations, and minimum meeting durations. Public information: {environment->public_information} Traveler inputs: {traveler_options} Friend inputs: {paul_availability} Global goal: {agents->orchestrator->goal} Think step by step and output the domain and problem files suitable for FastDownward.
